conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D.
Predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
There are four outlets labeled A, B, C, and D at the top of the image.
There are three containers labeled E, F, and G at the bottom of the image.
There are baffles positioned between the outlets and containers.
Liquid from outlets A, B, C, and D will interact with the baffles.
The baffles will direct the flow of liquid towards one of the containers E, F, or G.
The final answer is that the liquid will flow into container G.
